Comment on the form (can be changed):
Hello! Please add my child as your ward.

Family Friends (Mentors) - teachers, educators, trainers, relatives, friends and other people, which can also accrue / subtract obols and offsets (control functions are provided by the parent individually). By interacting with mentors, the child will be more involved in the process of its development.

Tell the parent what you would like to receive -
 your goal. You need to achieve your goal.
 Parent will help you, he will say how
 way you can get it.

Please enable: 

 Turn off Miui Optimizations on Developer Settings, then Restart the phone. 
 Settings > Advanced Settings > Battery manager > Power plan is set to Performance 
 Device Settings > Advanced Settings > Battery Manager > Protected apps – your app needs to be Protected 
 Device Settings > Apps > your app > Battery > Power-intensive prompt and Keep running after screen off 
 Settings > Additional Settings > Battery and Performance > Manage apps’ battery usage and here: 
 1. Switch Power Saving Modes to Off 
 2. Choose the next options: Saving Power in The Background > Choose apps > select your app > Background Settings > No restrictions

At the end of the allotted time (SALVES) for the child, this device will be partially blocked. Choose one of the types of application control: 
 1) Test (only YouTube and Google Play are blocked) 
 2) Standard (everything is blocked except calls, SMS and instant messengers) 
 3) Custom (you yourself manually determine the list of allowed and blocked applications) 
 You can change these settings at any time.
Permission is required to obtain the IMEI of this device and to carry out further monitoring by parents.
You need to give permission for the application

For the application to work, you must provide access rights to the data. By clicking on the red arrow, you will go to the application settings with access to data. Find the eSparta app there and enable usage tracking for it. Go back to the Application.

eSparta mobile application is a service for effective interaction of parents and their children. The application has two tools: 1) OBOL (time limit The child behind the gadget); 2) AGREEMENT (conclusion of contracts between Parent and child). OBOL tool (from ancient Greek ὀβολός - a coin of Ancient Greece) is electronic coin equal to 20 minutes pro driving a child for a gadget. Parent counts as many obolov as it counts adequate for your child. Also obol accrued for the child’s performance ny actions or are deducted in the form of knowledge. The parent decides how to use this tool. CONTRACT tool used to conclude a parent-child contract com Each side must fulfill its obligations. The child must fulfill parent condition, for example, learn 50 but- English words, and the parent must reward the child for doing this tasks, for example, buy a child football ball. So the baby becomes motivated, shapes his goals, monitors the process of achievement, exerts effort and as a result gets what wanted to. And the parent also reaches his goals, because his child fulfills what useful and necessary. Parents should use caution Call these tools, Closely tracking their effects, clearly Assessing the capabilities of not only the child, But their own.

When used correctly, the app parents and their children will reach very great results in all directions laziness (sports, art, health, training, education, discipline, financial literacy, negotiation skills, etc.)

string-array.name: about_contract
string-array.item: Find out what the child would like to receive (Purpose of the child).
Set your conditions for the child, what he must do to achieve this goal.
Control and track the process of achieving the goal by the child.
If the child fulfills the conditions of the contract, fulfill your duty - provide the child with what he deserves.
Do not stop there, improve your child’s knowledge and skills, set goals and achieve them!

string-array.name: description_contract
string-array.item: For example, a soccer ball, ice cream, a movie trip to the Lion King.
The child will see his target on his device.

Examples of one step: 
 - 15 push ups 
 - learn 5 new words in english 
 - go to bed at 22.00h and so on...
How many steps should a child take to achieve his goal? \n The child will see progress on his device- \n Do not forget to manually count each step.

string-array.name: title_contract
string-array.item: Indicate the purpose of the child
Indicate what a child must do to complete one step

One coin equals 20 minutes of gadget operation. If you run out of coins, the gadget will blocked. To resume work gadget, the parent from his account can add coins. We recommend giving coins to your child for any useful actions.
